summary: This is a service request record from September 28, 2019, for programming and adding Vicon V942 IP cameras to Qognify at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The request was made by the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) and indicates a need for technical assistance with camera configuration.

events.title: Camera Programming Service Request
events.description: A service request was created to program and add Vicon V942 IP cameras to the Qognify system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

keyFacts: The document is a service request for technical work on security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The request was made by the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) and dated September 28, 2019.
The specific need was programming the correct ONVIF port number in Vicon V942 IP cameras to allow connectivity to the Sitebuilder system.
The location is identified as MCC New York, which is where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.
The document appears to be routine maintenance/installation work order and does not directly reference any individuals involved in the Epstein case.
